name: Targeted Wrinkle Corrector
about: What it is:A treatment that helps erase the look of wrinkles by visibly smoothing and reducing wrinkle intensity..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Fine Lines/Wrinkles and Loss of Firmness/Elasticity.Highlighted Ingredients:- Acetyl Hexapeptide-8: Boosts elasticity to help prevent formation of future wrinkles..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, and sulfates SLS & SLES. These products are also gluten-free and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:When you canu2019t make it to the dermatologist for a filler, this powerful peptide-meets-hyaluronic treatment virtually erases the look of wrinkles by visibly smoothing and reducing wrinkle intensity instantly.* This treatment works like an instant filler with highly bioavailable hyaluronic acid, flooding wrinklesu2014even deep-set, stubborn linesu2014with hydration to visibly plump, smooth, and reduce wrinkle intensity on contact..Clinical Results:Results reported by trial participants in a 4-week clinical study, immediately after application:
ingredients: -Acetyl Hexapeptide-8: Boosts elasticity to help prevent formation of future wrinkles..-Bioavailable Hyaluronic Acid: Intensely hydrates to visibly plump, smooth, and reduce wrinkle intensity instantly..-Plant-Derived Squalane: Prevents moisture loss to help skin resist future wrinkles...Water/Aqua/Eau, Polysilicone-11, Squalane, Propanediol, Cetyl Alcohol, Sodium Acrylates Crosspolymer-2, Potassium Cetyl Phosphate, Polyglyceryl-3 Laurate, Urea, Yeast Amino Acids, Trehalose, Inositol, Taurine, Betaine, Laureth-12, Chlorphenesin, Barium Sulfate, Sodium Acetylated Hyaluronate, Sodium Carbonate, Disodium EDTA, Glyceryl Oleate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Acetyl Hexapeptide-8, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol, Tocopherol.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply to clean, dry skin..-Gently squeeze product out and tap into wrinkle with the metal side..-If needed, use ring finger to gently tap into wrinkle. Donu2019t rub in. Pat dry..-Follow by applying Retinol Youth Renewal Serum (sold separately). .-At night, follow with Retinol Youth Renewal Night Cream (sold separately). .-During the day, follow with your favorite serum, moisturizer, and SPF.

reviews.review_text: Itu2019s hard for me to not write reviews as a physician so bear with me. Hexapeptide 8 is the new u201citu201d ingredient thatu2019s found in many plumping products these days. Itu2019s known by a few names. Itu2019s the closest topical ingredient to Botox so itu2019s in a lot of things from Paulau2019s Choice (Rescue and repair intensive moisturizer) to The Ordinaryu2019s Argireline 10% solution. Same ingredient, different names. Do they work? Yes, for most people. It doesnu2019t last long though and if itu2019s not formulated properly it can leave a waxy residue. This product is decent. It would be better as a moisturizer but people love u201ctargeted treatmentsu201d because it tricks the brain into spending more money if the u2018magicu2019 ingredient seems to be in stronger percentages. Is it going to do anything for wrinkles longterm? No. HA and squalane simply hydrate the skin so wrinkles appear more plump. Only things that actually fix wrinkles are Botox, fillers, laser treatments, retinoids and vitamin C. The rest just make them less noticeable and most companies do admit that as you can see when they say, u201creduces the appearance of wrinkles.u201d This isnu2019t going to do anything longterm so donu2019t expect that. At most, it plumps lines for a few hours and hydrates. If you want to skip Botox, etc, use a retinoid 4x a week, increase your moisture and choose one with peptides (Peter Thomas Roth has one called skinjection that has this ingredient and more for a full plumping effect). I love Muradu2019s retinol and retinal. Throw in a vitamin C and broad spectrum sunscreen and youu2019ll see permanent changes. This product is a u201cfake it til you make itu201d product so if it works for you and makes you happy, thatu2019s what matters. :)

reviews.review_title: Nice at filling out lines and creases
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So far Iu2019m pretty impressed with the results. While the lines are not gone they are definitely a  smoother and look more refined when using. This product was easy to apply to my skin. There was no redness or irritation. This is most definitely something Iu2019m going to continue using as part of my morning skin care routine. Keep in mind that this product is meant to just plump up wrinkles or lines by using hyaluronic acid. Normally I apply moisturizer several times to those areas but it causes piling with the product and with my concealer. I like the fact it comes in a tube and I can just squeeze it in the area I want to concentrate on.  I apply products like this especially before applying foundation or concealer so it wonu2019t settle in the lines and crease. I only have to use this one product instead of applying moisturizer several times. Iu2019m definitely going to use the entire tube.
